My Team?  Well I really don't use one, I fight solo with a cleric, that way
he can get his exp quicker and i can buff him up with the money i collecy,
he can use raise undead for anything he kills so i will have a massive team
built by my pc cleric.  I think that overall, clerics are the best
character.  By the way, as for my gladiator lvs i am working on a zip for
all 50 lvs and also individual zips for each lv. so that's why i'm taking so
long getting the zips set up sorry for the wait.

From: crayner <crayner@...>

Sent: Monday, July 03, 2000 1:35 PM
Subject: Re: [gladiator] (strat/levels)


> Re: best team
>
> When I was working through the levels, I found that sometimes your
computer
> controlled PCs do stupid things.  They are very brave, (anyone seen
> somethingawful.com's FPS guidelines?) and will run at the bad guys,
thereby
> discarding any possibility of personal safety for the team.
>
> The problem with this, is that sometimes your level 5 cleric will try and
> attack
> that level 8 warrior, at the very moment the rest of the team is
preoccupied
> with
> Torvald the terrible.
>
> My remedy for this is to use a small team, and use the shout button often.
> If
> working on a fairly difficult level that is swarming with foes, you should
> lead
> your group with your slowest group member.  Mages, I find, are really good
> for
> leading a group because they have fireballs that do considerable initial
> damage,
> and being able to see what's coming up with a character like that so you
can
>
> get him out of the way is a good idea.
>
> It's also been my policy, that for an efficient team you should have at
> least two
> clerics.  One cleric is prone to hurt himself and have nowhere to go for
> healing
> except for the health that may be on the other side of the map in a large
> level,
> while two can keep each other in good shape and also keep the area secure
> with a deadly barrier of mystic maces.
>
> My team?  Two clerics and one mage.  I've been debating with myself what
is
> better, an archmage or a mage -- the archmage has some powerful
destruction
> spells, but no archmage can compete with the flame-throwing power of the
> mage's energy blast.  And who can resist stop time?  So it's up to you.  I
> always
> use one of these, however, as my leading PC, because they are slower than
> the
> clerics and will remain that way for most of the game if you keep the
> clerics'
> dexterities at even levels with the mages.  I can switch quickly between
the
> two
> clerics, setting up fields of mystic mace that protect the rear end of the
> team from
> melee attacks, as well as healing up the other members of my team quickly
> with
> a quick switch and heal.
>
> During the first few levels, this team pathetic.  They are too slow to
keep
> up with
> Commander and Troy, unless you call those two in and go deliberately ahead
> to
> try and beat off those elves in the first level.  They are prone to an
easy
> death if
> you don't take special care to keep the clerics healing up, and the
clerics
> are pretty
> weak too until you get their intelligence up to the point where they can
use
> mystic
> mace.  Once you get mystic mace on one of your clerics, then you're
rolling
> -- but
> until that point, you are going to be struggling (especially on battle or
> slaughter
> mode!). Hope that helps.
>
> re: fifty levels
>
> Awesome, Tevildo. I will be checking them out shortly -- thanks a lot for
> putting
> those up there for us all to enjoy.
>
> -Chris/Shayd
